page.text: "To the west lies a fertile yet perilous jungle. You can brave its winding paths if you wish, and many do to forage for fruits. But I should warn you the area is beset with voracious lamia, their coils are strong as the trees that surround them and should they entrap you your submission will be swift in coming. As will you ending up a melting bulge in their tail." she pauses a moment and then continues "If you should somehow survive the jungle though there are open lands beyond them. The creatures there are strong when roused to anger, so keep your distance."

page.text: "To the south is a valley which is the only land upon which the tastey Deku nut tree will grow. Which is a shame as it is beset by raptors, these lizard folk cannot be bargained with and will devour you with a surety once they have laid you low with their claws. The only saving grace is they lack courage when alone. We think perhaps they make their nest in the ancient ruins. You should avoid the ruins if you can, they are dangerous as the last person to travel there did not return."

So I tell you now, avoid the ruins in the valley."

page.text: The priestess brings you before the village, ringing a bell to bring forth additional green elves to gather. And announces to them "You see before you the stranger from the stars, she came to us alone. She did not know us, yet she gave of herself to us. Now she has affirmed her desire for a deeper friendship. So it is time for us to give of ourselves to this stranger, you are alone no longer, we will comfort you, we will protect you, we will provide for you. and though your journey may take you far, know that we will always welcome you. Let all know that you are kin of the queendi, and rejoice." after the ceremony there is much cheering and celebration. You have sworn allegiance to the village of minyos.

"Yes? you want us to call you friend? and what have you done for the Quendi?" the priestess asks with a sardonic eyebrow "Go, show that you are friend of quendi, then we will call you friend of quendi."

"Normally I would not share such things. But you have proven a friend of our people. So I will tell you. For many generations we have lived upon this, our home. In peace we traded with star travellers such as yourselves who visited this world. All this ended when the ancient enemy came from the stars. They invaded seeking our land and our wealth. These reptilian monsters were relentless, we fought them and the struggle lasted many years. Their evil depredations caused us to lose many wonders we once knew. Finally we called upon the great spirits of the sky, who destroyed the ancient enemy. The way to what was once their lands forever cut off."

page.text: "The lizards you speak of are a pale imitation of the evil of their progenitors. When we drove them forth the callous creatures did not seek to take with them their unborn young, several clutches survived and grew to be the ones of which you speak. But without the words and wisdoms of their foul ancestors they are but little threat, they're actually rather tastey and alone are no match for a Quendi."
"Our history is not to be shared with outsiders."

"Ah so good of you to ask traveller. I've misplaced a statue, it has ritual significance. But if it's not here it must be in the village somewhere. If you could do me the favour of fetching it for me I would be ever so grateful."

"Yes but I am expecting a visitor soon. And I wouldn't want to leave this place unattended. Besides, you're a new visitor here and have an adventuresome look to you. You're probably going to search the entire village for hidden secrets or other such nonsense while bothering the residents so you may as well be useful to me while you do so."
